medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The onset of major depression started 4 years ago, preceded by a series of major life events within a 1-year period, including the death of her mother, divorce from her husband, and her son's departure from home. Symptoms intensified over time, leading to an inability to work, suicidal attempts, and multiple inpatient treatments without improvement. On admission, she exhibited pronounced symptoms of anhedonia, loss of energy, and pervasive negative thought biases.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of stable and focal bilateral amygdala lesions due to lipoid proteinosis of Urbach and Wiethe; previously no history of major depression.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's monozygotic twin sister shares the same Urbach-Wiethe phenotype and amygdala pathology.
medical_history.social_history: Social network size declined from 17 people in 2012 to 10 in 2018, with low complexity and high levels of loneliness (UCLA Loneliness Scale score of 47).
